translation: rozczarowany, zniechęcony [no longer satisfied with your situation, organization, belief, etc. and therefore not loyal to it]
sentence: Some disaffected members left to form a new party.

translation: granie pod publikę [informal; acting or speaking in a way intended to attract the good opinion of other people who are watching]
sentence: Experts criticized the program as mere grandstanding by corporations and local officials.

translation: porywczy [likely to do something suddenly, without considering the results of your actions]
sentence: He's so impetuous - why can't he think things over before he rushes into them?

translation: nie do przezwyciężenia [formal; (especially of a problem) so great or severe that it cannot be defeated or dealt with successfully]
sentence: Things which defeated you a short time ago are no longer insuperable.

translation: płat [any part of an organ that seems to be separate in some way from the rest, especially one of the parts of the brain, lungs, or liver]
sentence: The x-rays were conclusive and indicated a bad infection in the lower lobe of one lung.

translation: pochopnie [formal; in a way that is too sudden and done without thinking]
sentence: Scientists are annoyed that the research programme has been abandoned so precipitately.

translation: bagno, trzęsawisko [an area of soft, wet ground that you sink into if you try to walk on it; a difficult and dangerous situation]
sentence: The heavy rain soon turned the field into a quagmire. Since the coup, the country has sunk deeper into a quagmire of violence and lawlessness.

translation: spoczynek, odpoczynek [literary; a state of rest, sleep, or feeling calm]
sentence: The first rays of morning sun disturbed their repose.

translation: popłoch, panika [an occasion when many large animals or many people suddenly all move quickly and in an uncontrolled way, usually in the same direction at the same time, especially because of fear]
sentence: Two shoppers were injured in the stampede as shop doors opened on the first day of the sale.

translation: grobowiec, grób [a large stone structure or underground room where someone, especially an important person, is buried]
sentence: When they opened up the tomb they found treasure beyond their wildest dreams.
